DOC.HEAD: Strong Earthquake Recorded Off Guam
DOC.TEXT: A strong earthquake off Guam shook the western Pacific, the Hong Kong Observatory said Sunday. There were no immediate reports of damage or injury. The observatory said the quake, which occurred Saturday, registered 5.5 on the Richter scale. The quake's epicenter was 322 miles northeast of Guam, the observatory said. Guam is one of the Marianas Islands about 1,500 miles east of the Philippines. There were no further details on the quake. The open-ended Richter scale measures ground motion as recorded on seismographs. Each increase of one number means a tenfold increase in magnitude. An earthquake measuring 6 can cause severe damage in populated areas.
